briefdescription.para: Enum to be use as a Mode.

listitem.para: DELETE_NOISE Enumeration indicating that the user is in a mode enabling him to delete noisy spikes.
DELETE_ARTEFACT Enumeration indicating that the user is in a mode enabling him to delete artefact spikes.
NEW_CLUSTER Enumeration indicating that the user is in a mode enabling him to create a new cluster.
NEW_CLUSTERS Enumeration indicating that the user is in a mode enabling him to create new clusters.
SELECT_TIME Enumeration indicating that the user is in a mode enabling him to select a time window which will be display in a TraceView.

briefdescription.para: Buffer to enable smooth updating, obtain flicker-free drawing.
Reference on the view containing this widget.
The document containing the data the widget is representing.
List of clusters to update when the view will become the active one.
Pointer to the status bar of the application.

memberdef.argsstring: (KlustersDoc &doc, KlustersView &view, QColor backgroundColor, KStatusBar *statusBar, QWidget *parent=0, const char *name=0, int minSize=500, int maxSize=4000, int windowTopLeft=-500, int windowBottomRight=1001, int border=0, int Xborder=0, int Yborder=0)
memberdef.name: ViewWidget

briefdescription.para: Constructs the view.

parameterdescription.para: the document instance the view represents.
the global view including this view of the data.
color used as background.
a reference to the application status bar.
the parent QWidget.
name of the widget (can be used for introspection).
minumum size of the view.
maximum size of the view.
the top-left corner of the window (QRect corresponding to the part of the drawing which will actually be drawn onto the widget).
bottom-right corner of the window (QRect corresponding to the part of the drawing which will actually be drawn onto the widget).
size of the border between the frame and the contents.
border on the left and right sides inside the window (QRect corresponding to the part of the drawing which will actually be drawn onto the widget).
border on the top and bottom sides inside the window (QRect corresponding to the part of the drawing which will actually be drawn onto the widget).

briefdescription.para: Takes into account the update of the dimension used to present the clusters.
Updates the view only for one cluster for which the color has been changed.

parameterdescription.para: cluster Id for which the color have changed.
true if the view is the active one, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Adds an additional cluster to those already shown.

detaileddescription.para:
This method aims to reduce the number of clusters to draw.
clusterId
cluster Id to add to the clusters already drawn
active
true if the view is the active one, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Removes a cluster from those already shown.

parameterdescription.para: cluster Id to remove.
true if the view is the active one, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Adds a newly created cluster to those already shown.

detaileddescription.para:
This method aims to reduce the number of clusters to draw.
fromClusters
list of clusters from which the spikes of the new cluster are coming.
clusterId
cluster Id to add to the clusters already drawn
active
true if the view is the active one, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Adds a newly created cluster to those already shown.

detaileddescription.para:
This method aims to reduce the number of clusters to draw.
clusterId
cluster Id to add to the clusters already drawn
active
true if the view is the active one, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Updates the content of the widget due to the removal of spikes in a cluster.

detaileddescription.para:
This method aims to reduce the number of clusters to draw.
fromClusters
list of clusters from which the spikes have been taken.
active
true if the view is the active one, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Updates the content of the widget due to the addition of spikes in a cluster.

detaileddescription.para:
This method aims to reduce the number of clusters to draw.
clusterId
cluster Id to which the spikes have been added
active
true if the view is the active one, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Method called when no spikes have been found in a polygon of selection.
Updates the clusters which have been modified by the suppression of spikes (used to create a new cluster or simply move to the cluster of noise or artefact).

detaileddescription.para:
This method aims to reduce the number of clusters to draw.
modifiedClusters
list of clusters from which spikes were taken from.
active
true if the view is the active one, false otherwise.
isModifiedByDeletion
true if the clusters of modifiedClusters have been modified by the deletion of spikes (moved to cluster 0 or 1, cluster of artefact abd cluster of noise respectively).

briefdescription.para: Updates the clusters which have been modified by the suppression of spikes (used to create a new cluster or simply move to the cluster of noise or artefact).

detaileddescription.para:
This method is called only during an undo otherwise the updateClusters is call. There are 2 functions in order to reduce the number of clusters to draw whenever possible.
modifiedClusters
list of clusters from which spikes were taken from.
active
true if the view is the active one, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Enables the caller to know if there is any thread running launch by the viewWidget.
Prints the currently display information on a printer via the painter printPainter.

parameterdescription.para: painter on a printer.
object providing information about the printer.
true if the printed background has to be white, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Base class for the most of the views of the application (ClusterView, WaveformView, CorrelationView and ErrorMatrixView).

detaileddescription.para:
This class defineds the views common signal and slot communication with KlustersView. Thoses communication enable the views to be update themselves when the clusters have been changed. ViewWidget also contains the zoom feature of the views.
Lynn Hazan
